titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William H. Bird diary and account book, 1861-1867
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, 2017

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.unittitle: William H. Bird diary and account book
did.abstract: Chiefly Bird's diary (1866 Sept. 12-1867 June 22) while he was a resident near Brandywine Village, a suburb of Wilmington, Del. Records social, political, and family activities. Includes financial accounts for 1861, including agricultural labor, while Bird was at Summit Bridge.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: William H. Bird diary and account book, 1861-1867, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_section.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, January 2017.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Member of Bird family of Summit Bridge, Del. Son of John Thomas Bird (b. 1796) and brother of Brigadier General Charles Bird (1838-1920).

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Chiefly Bird's diary (1866 Sept. 12-1867 June 22) while he was a resident near Brandywine Village, a suburb of Wilmington, Del. Records social, political, and family activities. Includes financial accounts for 1861, including agricultural labor, while Bird was at Summit Bridge.
